testHelp

Class ConsoleTester

  • Object
    • ConsoleTester

  • public class ConsoleTester
extends Object
    Simplifies testing of a Java application with a main method that reads input from System.in and/or writes output to System.out through getOutput and related methods.

    This version is backward compatible with the original version, but extends it in two directions:

    1. Addition of optional informational output written to System.out, controlled by a settable verbosityLevel
    2. Extensions to the core ConsoleTester getOutput functionality

    These are described in more detail in the next two sections.

    1. Addition of optional informational output written to System.out, controlled by a settable verbosityLevel

    The extended version has a verboseLevel parameter whose initial value is 0 but which can be set to 1 or 2, normally via a static initializer in the test class, as: 

      static 
  {
          ConsoleTester.setVerbose(1); // or 2
  }
    If verboseLevel is 0, ConsoleTester getOutput and other library components behave essentially as they do on the original version of the library and write nothing to System.out, and write only stacktraces of uncaught exceptions (JUnit errors) to System.err. But if verboseLevel is 1 or 2, they write additional information to System.out, including the name of the test class, the name of the test within the test class, and other information. The only difference between 1 and 2 is that the test names are printed for all tests with verboseLevel 2 and only those with messages with verboseLevel 1.

    Note: When running inside eclipse both System.out and System.err go to the eclipse console, System.out appearing in black, System.err in red. Also filename + line number strings in both System.out and System.err text are clickable as they are in stacktraces and transfer focus to the file and line. And finally, the console output can be searched, and the full content or any part of it can be easily selected and copied to the clipboard for further use.

    For more on informational output produced by getOutput see OutputInfo.

    1. Extensions to the core ConsoleTester getOutput functionality

    The core getOutput functionality is now provided in two forms:

    1. Bundled - the original form - everything happens in a single call to one of the overloads of the getOutput method, which executes the main method internally, as:
    
  String output = ConsoleTester.getOutput("MyMainClass","some input\n");
    1. Unbundled - added in the new version - a direct invocation of main, wrapped in a try-catch together with getOutput<stage> methods that perform different stages of the complete getOutput process, as:
    
  String output;
  try 
  {
      ConsoleTester.getOutputStart("some input\n");
      MyMainClass.main(null);
      output = ConsoleTester.getOutputFinish();
  }
  catch (Throwable ex)
  {
      output = getOutputFromException(ex);
  }
    The bundled form is the original one; the unbundled form is an enhancement.

    The code between getOutputStart and getOutputFinish in the unbundled form is not limited to a call to a main routine, but can be any statement or sequence of statements for example: 

      String output;
  try 
  {
      ConsoleTester.getOutputStart(null); // called methods do not read from System.in
      Grid grid = new Grid(10,12);
      grid.set(0,0,"First cell");
      grid.set(9,11,"Last cell");
      //grid.set(10,12,"Last cell"); // would throw an out-of-bounds exception that would be processed by getOutputFromException, 
      grid.print();
     output = getOutputFinish();
  }
  catch (Throwable ex)
  {
      output = ConsoleTester.getOutputFromException(ex);
  }

    The enhanced version also provides new forms of bundled getOutput for calling main routines in different ways and also for calling methods other than main. Among them are:

    • The ability to provide With descriptions of what is being run, optional in backward compatible overloads, required new ones, as:
    
  String output = ConsoleTester.getOutput("MyMainClass","some input\n","MyMainClass::main + no args");
    • An overload of getOutput which allows an array of String arguments to be passed to the main routine, as:
    
  String output = ConsoleTester.getOutput("MyMainClass",new String[]{"arg1","arg2"},"some input\n","MyMainClass.main + two args");

    • An overload of getOutput which allows the main routine to be passed as a method reference rather than a class name, as:
      String output = ConsoleTester.getOutput(MyMainClass::main, null, "some input\n","MyMainClass::main + no args");

or:

  String output = ConsoleTester.getOutput(MyMainClass::main, new String[]{"arg1","arg2"},"some input\n","MyMainClass.main + two args");

    • A set of extended overloads of the form getOutputFromVFunction and getOutputFromVUnboundMethod and variants that make it possible to call methods other than main which can tae arguments of any type and return values of any type. The methods are normally passed as method references wrapped in overloaded converter functions makeVFunction and makeVUnbounMethod and variant, and can be references to static methods. bound instance methods and unbound instance methods (which require an instance of the class to be passed), as
     
  String output = ConsoleTester.getOutputFromVFunction(makeVFunction(TestClassWithSpecializedMethods::staticFunction_arg_int_return_int),
                                                       10,null,"TestClass::staticFunction_arg_int_return_int");
  Object value = ConsoleTester.getValueFromInfo();

or:

  TestClassWithSpecializedMethods instance = new TestClassWithSpecializedMethods();             
  String output = ConsoleTester.getOutputFromVFunction(makeVFunction(instance::instanceFunction_arg_int_return_int),
                                                       10,null,"instance::instanceFunction_arg_int_return_int");
  Object value = ConsoleTester.getValueFromInfo();

or:

  TestClassWithSpecializedMethods instance = new TestClassWithSpecializedMethods();
  String output = ConsoleTester.getOutputFromVUnboundMethod(makeVUnboundMethod(TestClassWithSpecializedMethods::instanceFunction_arg_int_return_int),
                                                            instance,10,null,"TestClassWithSpecializedMethods::instanceFunction_arg_int_return_int");
  Object value = ConsoleTester.getValueFromInfo();
    Examples of bundled and unbundled getOutput method calls can be found in various unittest files in test/testHelp including:
    • ConsoleTesterTests.java
    • ConsoleTesterVFunctionAndVUnboundMethodTest.javas
    • MiscTests.java
    • SampleOutputInfoPrintingTests.java - output in SampleOutputInfoPrintingTests-output.txt
    Author:
    ejewart, John Armstrong

    • Method Detail

      • getOutput

        public static String getOutput(String className,
                               String input,
                               String... descArg)
        A reimplementation of the original getOutput. Runs the main method in className, redirecting input to its System.in stream and capturing output to its System.out (and System.err) until the main routine returns, then returns captured output as a string. If the main routine throws an exception and does not return, or if an internal exception is thrown from within testHelp, returns instead a string representation of the exception.

        Calls getOutput(String className, String [] mainArgs, String input, String [] descArg) with null value for mainArgs.

        Parameters:
        className - qualified name of class to load (e.g. MyClass or MyPackage.MyClass)
        input - text to feed to System.in after main is called
        descArg - an optional description of what is being run - defaults to "<className>::main"
        Returns:
        any text output to System.out when main runs, of string representation of an uncaught exception

      • getOutput

        public static String getOutput(String className,
                               String[] mainArgs,
                               String input,
                               String... descArg)
        Like getOutput(String className, String input, String [] descArg), but allows an array of string arguments to be passed to the method.

        Loads the class if it has not already been loaded (which it ordinarily has been) and makes a Consumer functional object from the main method via makeStringArrayConsumerFromMainClassName(java.lang.String, java.lang.ClassLoader), makes a vFunction from the functional object via a makeVFunction overload, and passes the vFunction and the other arguments to getOutputFromVFunction(testHelp.VFunctionsAndVUnboundMethods.VFunction<A, R>, A, java.lang.String, java.lang.String).

        Parameters:
        className - the qualified name of class to load (e.g. MyClass or MyPackage.MyClass)
        mainArgs - an array of strings to be passed as args to main - no args may be passed as null or as new String[0]
        input - text to feed to System.in after main is called
        descArg - an optional description of what is being run - defaults to "<className>::main"
        Returns:
        any text output to System.out when main runs

      • getOutput

        public static String getOutput(Consumer<String[]> mainMethodReference,
                               String[] mainArgs,
                               String input,
                               String desc)
        An alternative implementation of getOutput, which runs the main method directly via a method reference to the class and main method of the form <simple-class-name>::main. Allows an array of string arguments to be passed to the method.

        Makes a vFunction from the functional object via a makeVFunction overload, and passes the vFunction and the other arguments to getOutputFromVFunction(testHelp.VFunctionsAndVUnboundMethods.VFunction<A, R>, A, java.lang.String, java.lang.String).

        Parameters:
        mainMethodReference - a functional object of type consumer<String []>, typically passed as a method reference
        mainArgs - an array of strings to be passed as args to main - no args may be passed as null or as new String[0]
        input - text to feed to System.in after main is called
        desc - a description of what is being run
        Returns:
        any text output to System.out when main runs

      • getOutputReset

        public static void getOutputReset()
        Reset OutputInfo.info - remembers testNameInfo, testClassNamPrinted and testNamPrinted, resets all other fields to initial state.

        Allows getOutputStart-getOutputFinish-getOutputFromException and similar sequences to be run more that once in the same test with output assigned to separate strings.

      • getOutputStart

        public static void getOutputStart(String input,
                                  String desc)
        Initialize ConsoleTester for presenting input to and getting output from interactive code.

        This method must be called before any other getOutput.. methods except getOutputReset. It can be called after a call to getOutputReset, and can be called more than once if a call to getOutputRest is made between calls.

        Parameters:
        input - string representing input
        desc - a description of what is being run
        Throws:
        TestHelpError - if called twice without intervening call to getOutput

      • getOutputFinish

        public static String getOutputFinish()
        Third step in an unbundled getOutputStart-<run-user-code>-getOutputFinish-getOutputFromException sequence. If the run-user-code step does not throw an exception that it does not handle itself getOutputFinish will be called and the and will call getOutputFinalize internally and return a string representing the output from the
        Returns:
        any text output to System.out when main runs
        Throws:
        TestHelpError - if getoutputStart has not previously been called

      • getOutputFromException

        public static String getOutputFromException(Throwable ex)
        Alternative third step in getOutputStart-<run-user-code>-getOutputFinish-getOutputFromException sequence. The normal sequence getOutputStart-<run-user-code>-getOutputFinish should be placed in a try block and getOutputFromException should be placed in the catch block. Returns a string representation of the exception, just as bundled getOutput does when an exception is thrown and caught within the code.
        Parameters:
        ex - exception thrown by previously executed code
        Returns:
        a string representation of the exception
        Throws:
        TestHelpError - if getoutputStart has not previously been called

      • getOutputFinal

        public static String getOutputFinal()
        Finalize output. Called internally at end of getOutputFinish() and getOutputFromException(java.lang.Throwable), including within getOutput(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String...) and all top-level getOutput.. methods. Should not be called dir3ectly.
        Returns:
        any text output to System.out when main runs

      • makeStringArrayConsumerFromMainClassName

        public static Consumer<String[]> makeStringArrayConsumerFromMainClassName(String className,
                                                                          ClassLoader classLoader)
        Make a Consumer<String []> object (the functional type of the standard Java static main method) from a string consisting of a package name and the name of the class containing the main routine to run.

        May throw WrappedException in two situations:

        • Could not load class or execute its main method - internal flag = true, wrapped exception = exception thrown by code in this method
        • Loaded class main and executed main but main threw exception - internal flag = false, wrapped exception = exception thrown from within main
        Parameters:
        className - full name of class containing main method top be executed
        classLoader - classLoader object if different from default or null for default
        Returns:
        runnable functional object that throws no checked exceptions
        Throws:
        WrappedException - as explained above

      • getOutputFromVFunction

        public static <A,R> String getOutputFromVFunction(VFunctionsAndVUnboundMethods.VFunction<A,R> vFunction,
                                                  A arg,
                                                  String input,
                                                  String desc)
        Do the bundled getOutput sequence running with a generic vFunction functional object, normally passed as method reference, together with an argument of the appropriate type.

        Provided primarily to run standard Java main routines, which implement the Consumer<String []>) and can converted to a vFunction, but can be used to run any functional object which can be converted to a vFunction, including ones of the following types:

        • Runnable
        • Callable<R> and Supplier<R> and specializations
        • Consumer<A> and specializations
        • Function<A,R> and specializations
        The functional object may expressed as a method references to a static method, a method reference to a bound instance method, a lambda expression, or a variable to which any of these has been previously assigned.

        For usage with a main routine see getOutput(Consumer mainMethodReference, String [] mainArgs, String input, String desc), which calls through to this method.

        Type Parameters:
        A - the type of the argument passed to the vFunction
        R - the type of the value returned by the vFunction - will be VoidR for Runnable and Consumer
        Parameters:
        vFunction - a vFunction functional object which takes an argument of type <A> and returns a value of <R>
        arg - an argument of of type <A> - will be VoidA for Runnable, Callable and Supplier
        input - text to feed to System.in after method is called
        desc - a description of what is being run
        Returns:
        any text output to System.out when method runs

      • getOutputFromVUnboundMethod

        public static <C,A,R> String getOutputFromVUnboundMethod(VFunctionsAndVUnboundMethods.VUnboundMethod<C,A,R> vUnboundMethod,
                                                         C instance,
                                                         A arg,
                                                         String input,
                                                         String desc)
        Do the bundled getOutput sequence running with a generic vUnboundMethod functional object, normally passed as method reference, together with an instance and an argument of the appropriate type.

        Can be used to run any unbound instance method functional object which can be converted to a vUnboundMethod via an overload of the static method makeVUnboundMethod, including ones of the following types:

        • RunnableUnboundMethod<C>
        • CallableUnboundMethod<C,R> and SupplierUnboundMethod<C,R> and specializations
        • ConsumerUnboundMethod<C,A> and specializations
        • FunctionUnboundMethod<C,A,R> and specializations
        The functional object will normally be expressed as a method reference to an unbound method or variable to which such a reference has previously been assigned
        Type Parameters:
        C - the type of the instance passed to the vUnboundMethod
        A - the type of the argument passed to the vUnboundMethod
        R - the type of the value returned by the vFunction - will be VoidR for RunnableUnboundMethod and ConsumerUnboundMethod
        Parameters:
        vUnboundMethod - a vUnboundMethod functional object which takes an instance argument of type <C> and an argument of type <A> and returns a value of <R>
        instance - an argument of of type <C>
        arg - an argument of of type <A> - will be VoidA for RunnableUnboundMethod, CallableUnboundMethod and SupplierUnboundMethod
        input - text to feed to System.in after method is called
        desc - a description of what is being run
        Returns:
        any text output to System.out when method runs

      • getOutputFromVBiFunction

        public static <A1,A2,R> String getOutputFromVBiFunction(VFunctionsAndVUnboundMethods.VBiFunction<A1,A2,R> vBiFunction,
                                                        A1 arg1,
                                                        A2 arg2,
                                                        String input,
                                                        String desc)
        Do the bundled getOutput sequence running with a generic vFunction functional object, normally passed as method reference, together with an argument of the appropriate type.

        Can be used to run any functional object which can be converted to a vBiFunction, including ones of the following types:

        • BiConsumer<A1,A2> and specializations
        • BiFunction<A1,A2,R> and specializations
        Type Parameters:
        A1 - the type of the first argument passed to the vBiFunction
        A2 - the type of second the argument passed to the vBiFunction
        R - the type of the value returned by the vBiFunction - will be VoidR for BiConsumer
        Parameters:
        vBiFunction - a vBiFunction functional object which takes two arguments of type <A1> and <A2> and returns a value of <R>
        arg1 - an argument of type <A1>
        arg2 - an argument of type <A2>
        input - text to feed to System.in after consumer is called
        desc - a description of what is being run
        Returns:
        any text output to System.out when consumer runs

      • getOutputFromVBiUnboundMethod

        public static <C,A1,A2,R> String getOutputFromVBiUnboundMethod(VFunctionsAndVUnboundMethods.VBiUnboundMethod<C,A1,A2,R> vBiUnboundMethod,
                                                               C instance,
                                                               A1 arg1,
                                                               A2 arg2,
                                                               String input,
                                                               String desc)
        Do the bundled getOutput sequence running with a generic vBiUnboundMethod functional object, normally passed as method reference, together with an instance and two arguments of the appropriate types.

        Can be used to run any functional object which can be converted to a vBiUnboundMethod via an overload of the static method makeVBiUnboundMethod, including ones of the following types:

        • BiConsumerUnboundMethod<C,A1,A2> and specializations
        • BiFunctionUnboundMethod<C,A1,A2,R> and specializations
        .
        Type Parameters:
        C - the type of the instance passed to the vBiUnboundMethod
        A1 - the type of the first argument passed to the vBiUnboundMethod
        A2 - the type of the second argument passed to the vBiUnboundMethod
        R - the type of the value returned by the vBiUnboundMethod - will be VoidR for BiConsumerUnboundMethod

        arg1 - an argument of type <A1>
        arg2 - an argument of type <A2>
        input - text to feed to System.in after consumer is called
        desc - a description of what is being run
        Returns:
        any text output to System.out when consumer runs

      • getValueFromInfo

        public static Object getValueFromInfo()
        Get return value from OutputInfo.info if there is one, else null.

        Value will be non-null if method executed by getOutput has been called and returns normally. The value for void methods will be VFunctionsAndVUnboundMethods.voidR. It will be null only if no output method is is called or one is called but throws an exception.

        Returns:
        Object or null

      • getExceptionFromInfo

        public static Throwable getExceptionFromInfo()
        Get exception (actually Throwable - may be either Exception or Error) from OutputInfo.info if there is one, else null.
        Returns:
        Throwable or null

        Allows an alternate class loader to be specified. This is useful when compiling code on the fly.
        Parameters:
        loader - alternate class loader

      • getConsoleEncoding

        public static String getConsoleEncoding()
        Gets the encoding of System.out as of when this class was loaded. Calls getEncodingFromPrintStream(java.io.PrintStream) with System.out as argument.
        Returns:
        the standard name of the encoding

      • makePrintStreamFromOutputBytes

        public static PrintStream makePrintStreamFromOutputBytes(ByteArrayOutputStream outputBytes)
        Make a PrintStream from a ByteArrayOutputStream. Sets the encoding to the detected console encoding.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a new PrintStream with the appropriate encoding

      • outputBytesToString

        public static String outputBytesToString(ByteArrayOutputStream outputBytes)
        Convert bytes accumulated in a ByteArrayOutputStream to a string using the detected console encoding
        Parameters:
        outputBytes - a ByteOutputStream that has been created and (normally) written to by println or other method that writes strings
        Returns:
        a string representing the decoded version of the bytes

      • setVerboseLevel

        public static void setVerboseLevel(int level)
        Set verboseLevel to new value - normally called once per test class in a static initializer as described above.
        Parameters:
        level - 0 for completely silent, 1 print all messaged but not testnames for messages with no messages, 2 print all messages and all test names including ones with no messages

      • getVerboseLevel

        public static int getVerboseLevel()
        Get value of verboseLevel.
        Returns:
        current value of verboseLevel

      • getSystemIn

        public static InputStream getSystemIn()
        Get an InputStream object that getOutput methods can redirect to a buffer-based InputStream object that the routine it is calling can read input from - for passing the equivalent of System.in as a class instance or argument in a call to getOutputFromVFunction and getOutputFromVUnboundMethod and related functions.
        Returns:
        an InputStream object that will be redirected by getOutput method in parallel to System.in

      • getSystemOut

        public static PrintStream getSystemOut()

      • getSystemErr

        public static PrintStream getSystemErr()

      • printTestClassNameIfNotAlreadyPrinted

        public static void printTestClassNameIfNotAlreadyPrinted()
        Print test class name to System.out if it has not already been printed, else do nothing - prints regardless of verboseLevel.

        Rarely needs to be called directly.

        Calls OutputInfo.printTestClassNameIfNotAlreadyPrinted(PrintStream out).

        Important: this method must only be called when out is the real System.out, not a substitute

      • printTestNameIfNotAlreadyPrinted

        public static void printTestNameIfNotAlreadyPrinted()
        Print test name to System.out if it has not already been printed, else do nothing - prints regardless of verboseLevel.

        Also prints test class name if it has not already been printed.

        Generally does not need to be called directly, but is useful to do so in tests that write directly to System.out to make it clear what test the direct writing is happening in.

        Calls OutputInfo.printTestNameIfNotAlreadyPrinted(PrintStream out).

        Important: this method must only be called when out is the real System.out, not a substitute

      • printInfoIfNotAlreadyPrinted

        public static void printInfoIfNotAlreadyPrinted()
        Print output info to System.out if it has not already been printed, else do nothing - prints regardless of verboseLevel.

        Also prints test class name and test name if they have not already been printed.

        Important: this method must only be called when out is the real System.out, not a substitute

        Calls OutputInfo.printInfoIfNotAlreadyPrinted(PrintStream out).

        Important: this method must only be called when out is the real System.out, not a substitute

      • printChunkedStackTrace

        public static void printChunkedStackTrace(Throwable ex)
        Print stacktrace in chunked form to System.err.

        Calls ErrorOutputChunker.printChunkedStackTrace(java.lang.Throwable, java.io.PrintStream, java.lang.String, int)

        Important: this method must only be called when out is the real System.err, not a substitute

        Parameters:
        ex - a Throwable object (exception or error)

      • setDescription

        public static void setDescription(String desc)
        Set the test description - useful for cases where it is not set by a getOutput method. Will be printed along with other info if printInfoInfNotAlreadyPrinted is later called.
        Parameters:
        desc - a description of what is being tested

      • getTestName

        public static String getTestName()
        Get the name of the currently running test
        Returns:
        the bare test method name
